|- wi(wa(wceq(cdm(c1), cxp(crn(c1), crn(c1))), wceq(cxp(crn(c1), crn(c1)), cdm(c2))), wceq(cdm(cdm(c1)), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wi(wa(wceq(cdm(c1), cxp(crn(c1), crn(c1))), wceq(cxp(crn(c1), crn(c1)), cdm(c2))), wceq(cdm(c1), cdm(c2)))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((dom(c1)=(ran(c1)× ran(c1))∧(ran(c1)× ran(c1))= dom(c2))→ dom(dom(c1))= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ ((dom(c1)=(ran(c1)× ran(c1))∧(ran(c1)× ran(c1))= dom(c2))→ dom(c1)= dom(c2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(cdm(cdm(c1)), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(c2nd, c0))
-| wi(wa(wceq(cdm(c1), cxp(crn(c1), crn(c1))), wceq(cxp(crn(c1), crn(c1)), cdm(c2))), wceq(cdm(c1), cdm(c2)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → dom(dom(c1))= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ c1 =(1st ` c0)
⊣ c2 =(2nd ` c0)
⊣ ((dom(c1)=(ran(c1)× ran(c1))∧(ran(c1)× ran(c1))= dom(c2))→ dom(c1)= dom(c2))

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wceq(cdm(c1), cxp(crn(c1), crn(c1))), wceq(cxp(crn(c1), crn(c1)), cdm(c2))), wceq(cdm(c1), cdm(c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(cdm(cdm(c1)), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(c2nd, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → dom(dom(c1))= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ c1 =(1st ` c0)
⊣ c2 =(2nd ` c0)

comment: In a unital ring the domain of the first variable of the addition equals the domain of the first variable of the multiplication. (Contributed by FL, 24-Jan-2010.) (New usage is discouraged.)
